revised_title: Address Delivered before the Royal Society: Anniversary Meeting and Scientific Updates
tldr: The Marquis of Northampton, President of the Royal Society, addresses the Anniversary Meeting, discussing the resignation of Sir John Lubbock as Treasurer, updates on magnetic observations, and the scientific congress held at Cambridge. He also mentions the successful return of the vessel sent to complete the magnetic survey of the southern hemisphere and the upcoming Arctic expedition led by Sir John Franklin.
